main event: A radar return was observed indicating a small, round object with erratic movements near Buffalo, N.Y. on March 24, 1958.
interesting points: The object exhibited vertical and horizontal movements that did not conform to known aircraft characteristics,The observation lasted approximately one hour,The object climbed to 10,000 feet and descended rapidly,The radar return was described as bright and fast,There were no visual sightings made by the operators.
sighted object: a small round object on radar
witness description: Operators of the ground radar installation
